sense.name: a customary behavior or habit
sense.examples: John has adopted the local practice of double-parking on Main Street. It is the university's practice to grant a sabbatical to tenured faculty every seven years. Mary was annoyed by Greg's practice of throwing his jacket on the floor.

sense.name: a rehearsal or drill
sense.examples: Billy goes to baseball practice every day after school. Sally felt out of practice throwing a big dinner party. Practice makes perfect. The golfers spent an hour at the practice range.

sense.name: concrete enactment of an idea or concept
sense.examples: Ted thinks those politicians should practice what they preach. This will be a hard strategy to put into practice. In practice, almost no investors in futures actually have a commodity delivered to their home.

sense.name: exercise of a profession
sense.examples: Bob is trying to build up his psychiatric practice in Atlanta. She gave up her medical practice because of liability insurance. He has a very successful law practice in San Francisco.

sense.name: the location, premises, of a professional business
sense.examples: He has a dental practice on Elm Street. Their law practice caught fire from a smoldering cigarette in the ladies' room.
